intro: Blepharispermum zanguebaricum, commonly known as the Zanzibar sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or rocky areas. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to arid and coastal environments.
